intro: Colmeiroa buxifolia, commonly known as the boxleaf heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with small, leathery leaves resembling those of boxwood. It produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in spring, which are often fragrant. Colmeiroa buxifolia thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
